intro: Hieracium sauzei subsp. subsauzei, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and basal rosettes of leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite inflorescences, which are typical of the daisy family. It thrives in rocky and gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in mountainous environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its habitat.
